definition: to get really angry
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
surname Mao
old variant of 冒[mao4]
surname San
three/3
measure of length, ten Chinese feet (3.3 m)/to measure/husband/polite appellation for an older male

sentences.english: Her father will be furious if you try to back out of the marriage now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你现在想赖婚，她父亲一定会火冒三丈。

sentences.english: My mum’ll have hysterics when she sees the colour of my hair.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈看到我头发染成这种颜色会火冒三丈的。

sentences.english: She called him a rascal and at that he bridled up.
sentences.chinese: 她骂他流氓，他一听就火冒三丈。

sentences.english: When I talked to her last week about going on a diet， she got so mad.
sentences.chinese: 上个星期我劝她进行节食的时候，她却火冒三丈。

sentences.english: I enjoy getting arise out of him.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢把他气得火冒三丈。

sentences.english: He saw red when he lost his money.
sentences.chinese: 当他遗失钱的时候，他火冒三丈气炸了。

sentences.english: Her criticism were enough to make anyone see red.
sentences.chinese: 她那些批评任谁都得火冒三丈。

sentences.english: Now Russia is seething, and demands $450.
sentences.chinese: 如今俄罗斯火冒三丈，要求450美元。

sentences.english: I was furious with myself for my ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 我火冒三丈，我为我的无知。

sentences.english: Furious, his mother hauled him back to school and forced him to apologize to the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他的母亲火冒三丈，把他拖回学校，逼他向老师道歉。

sentences.english: By this time the pedder was really very very angry.
sentences.chinese: 但是这次，小贩真是火冒三丈了。

sentences.english: Of course, this makes the lion furious, but the crowd loves it.
sentences.chinese: 自然的，这让狮子火冒三丈，但观众却很喜欢。

sentences.english: He is mad with the dog for biting his new shoe.
sentences.chinese: 够咬了他的新鞋，他气得火冒三丈。

sentences.english: I am really furious about it.
sentences.chinese: 我对那件事真是火冒三丈。

definition: stamp with fury/fly into a rage
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to abuse roundly
angry/indignant
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to get angry/to fume
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles
to get mad/to be very angry
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
furious/enraged
